intro: Osteospermum burchellii, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 30 cm, and features hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are composed of a central disc surrounded by ray florets, and it blooms throughout the warmer months. Osteospermum burchellii is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
